subject: Does JUnit TestCase terminate threads?
msgSnippet: My apologies if the question seems naive but I have been testing a program where the loop inside the run() method of a class which implements Runnable should
messageBody:
My apologies if the question seems naive but I have been testing a program
where
the loop inside the run() method of a class which implements Runnable should

NOT terminate, and yet it does seem to terminate.

I see the message similar to the following:

Time: 0.566

.. near the point of termination.

Is it possible that the Junit TestCase class imposes a time limit, or is
there something about the Runnable interface that I need to
underatand better, or do I need to look even more closely
at my own code?

TIA

James
